title: Indeed
description: Leading job search website with millions of job listings from companies and job boards across the web. Offers resume posting, company reviews, and salary information.
address: 6433 Champion Grandview Way Bldgs I & II, Austin, TX 78750

title: LinkedIn Jobs
description: Professional networking platform with integrated job search functionality, company pages, and professional development resources.

title: Glassdoor
description: Job search platform featuring company reviews, salary information, interview insights, and workplace culture ratings from employees.

title: Monster
description: Global employment website for job seekers and employers. Provides job listings, career advice, resume services, and recruitment solutions.

title: CareerBuilder
description: Employment website providing job listings, resume database, and human capital solutions for employers and job seekers.
address: 200 N La Salle St, Suite 1100, Chicago, IL 60601

title: ZipRecruiter
description: AI-powered job matching platform connecting job seekers with employers through smart matching technology and mobile-friendly applications.

title: SimplyHired
description: Job search engine aggregating listings from job boards, newspapers, associations, and company career pages.

title: FlexJobs
description: Curated job board specializing in remote, part-time, freelance, and flexible schedule job opportunities across various industries.

title: Dice
description: Technology-focused job board and career community connecting tech professionals with employers seeking IT talent.
address: 6465 Wayzata Blvd, St. Louis Park, MN 55426

title: AngelList (Wellfound)
description: Platform connecting startups with talent, investors, and job seekers interested in startup and tech company opportunities.

title: AFL-CIO Apprenticeship Program
description: Labor federation offering apprenticeship and training programs for union organizers and workers across various trades and industries.
address: 815 Black Lives Matter Plaza NW, Washington, DC 20006

title: Department of Labor - Apprenticeship Programs
description: Federal agency overseeing registered apprenticeship programs nationwide, providing resources for employers and apprentices.

title: National Association of Manufacturers (NAM)
description: Leading manufacturing trade association representing over 14,000 member companies, offering advocacy, workforce development, and industry resources.

title: Associated General Contractors of America (AGC)
description: Premier association for the construction industry, providing training, education, safety programs, and advocacy for contractors.

title: International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW)
description: Labor union representing electrical workers, offering apprenticeship programs, training, and career advancement in electrical trades.

title: Building and Construction Trades Council
description: Alliance of building trades unions providing apprenticeship opportunities and career pathways in construction industries.

title: National Restaurant Association
description: Trade association for the restaurant and foodservice industry, offering training programs, certifications, and career resources.
address: 2055 L Street NW, Suite 700, Washington, DC 20036

title: American Trucking Associations (ATA)
description: Premier trade association for the trucking industry, providing training programs, safety resources, and career advancement opportunities.
address: 950 N Glebe Rd, Suite 210, Arlington, VA 22203

title: National Association of Home Builders (NAHB)
description: Trade association for the home building industry, offering training, certification programs, and career development in construction.

title: United Association of Plumbers and Pipefitters
description: Labor union providing apprenticeship and training programs for plumbers, pipefitters, and HVAC technicians across North America.

title: Small Business Administration (SBA)
description: Federal agency supporting small businesses through loans, counseling, contracting opportunities, and entrepreneurship programs.

title: SCORE Business Mentors
description: SBA resource partner providing free mentoring, workshops, and resources to help entrepreneurs start and grow successful businesses.
address: 712 H St NE PMB 98848, Washington, DC 20002

title: Women's Business Centers (WBC)
description: SBA-funded centers providing counseling, training, and resources specifically designed to help women entrepreneurs start and grow businesses.
address: 10 G Street NE, Suite 600, Washington, DC 20002

title: Small Business Development Centers (SBDC)
description: SBA-funded centers providing free business consulting, training, and technical assistance to entrepreneurs and small business owners.

title: Business.gov (SBA Business Portal)
description: Government portal providing comprehensive business information, regulations, and resources for starting and operating a business.

title: MINORITY BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT AGENCY (MBDA)
description: Federal agency fostering the growth of minority-owned businesses through strategic partnerships, innovative access to capital, and markets.

title: Economic Development Administration (EDA)
description: Federal agency promoting economic development in distressed communities through grants, technical assistance, and investment programs.

title: Veterans Business Outreach Center (VBOC)
description: SBA program providing entrepreneurial development services to veterans, service members, and military spouses interested in business ownership.

title: Coursera
description: Global online learning platform offering courses, certificates, and degree programs from top universities and companies worldwide.
address: 2440 West El Camino Real, Suite 500, Mountain View, CA 94040

description: Professional development platform offering business, technology, and creative skills courses taught by industry experts.

description: Online learning marketplace with courses on programming, business, design, marketing, and personal development taught by expert instructors.

title: CompTIA
description: Leading provider of vendor-neutral IT certifications, training, and resources for technology professionals and organizations.

title: Pluralsight

description: Professional certificate programs designed to prepare learners for in-demand jobs in high-growth fields like data analytics and UX design.

title: AWS Training and Certification
description: Cloud computing training and certification programs from Amazon Web Services, covering various AWS technologies and roles.
